page.title: 13Keadby Lock
page.content: It is situated at the eastern end of the canal where it meets the River Trent.Notices displayed remind one of the danger of rabies.The lock sides were built by masons who milled the stones exactly so metal ties sufficed instead of mortar.On the river side of the lock gates roman numerals have been carved into the stone side to indicate the depth of the river.The lock keeper cannot pen when the river gets to a depth of 6.3m as that is the height of the canal.The 1st and 3rd gates of the lock are flood gates,the others being canal gates.The gates and balancing beams are made of solid oak. It is a wide beam lock 6.6m wide;the canal lock is 26.1m long and the flood lock 22.8m long.The floor of the lock is oak panelled.In November this year it is due to be dewatered for repair- work and the sides will be landscaped.
